page.title: 06Hills and Views
page.content: The{Quantock Hills}occupy the three kilometre squares in the{East}of this Block. They are designated as an {Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty}and as they rise to over three hundred metres they afford{spectacular views } over the surrounding countryside. One{viewpoint}popular with local residents and holidaymakers alike is to be found at{Staple Plain.}To get there you have to take the very steep road opposite Staple Farm. There is a large Car Park situated between the {Forestry Commission}plantation and the {open moorland. } From this vantage point there are views over the village of{Williton } {towards Minehead and Dunkery Beacon on {Exmoor. }To the{North}there are views over the{Bristol Channel}with its twin islands of{Steep Holm and Flat Holm}to the coast of{South Wales. }
